companyInfo.companyDescription:
Since our founding in 1998, Google has grown by leaps and bounds. Starting from two computer science students in a university dorm room, we now have thousands of employees and offices around the world. These Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe.

It starts with how we work together. We‚Äôre building a company where people of different views, backgrounds and experiences can do their best work and show up for one another. A place where every Googler feels like they belong.

Since our founding in 1998, Google has grown by leaps and bounds. Starting from two computer science students in a university dorm room, we now have over a hundred thousand employees and over one hundred offices around the world. These Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. So whether you want to be a part of developing innovative technology, campaigns, products or partnerships, your work here is a chance to accomplish things that matter. To learn more about our job opportunities, teams, offices, benefits and workplace culture, visit careers.google.com.

json.description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Dublin, Ireland; Tel Aviv, Israel.
Minimum qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
‚Ä¢ 6 years of experience with cloud native architecture in a customer-facing or support role.
‚Ä¢ Experience in selling or supporting business intelligence tools, and using them for datasets and databases (e.g., Looker).
‚Ä¢ Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders.
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate in Hebrew and English fluently to support client relationship management in Israel and English speaking countries.

Preferred qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a technical field.
‚Ä¢ Experience developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch or real-time event processing, and ETL workflow solutions.
‚Ä¢ Experience analyzing data with SQL, Python, or R.
‚Ä¢ Experience with advanced data modeling and analytics.

About the job

As a key member of Looker's Enterprise Sales Engineering team, you will be the technical advocate for prospects and customers. You will work closely to understand their needs and demonstrate how Looker can add value to their data workflows. You will partner with your business counterparts to acquire new customers, expand relationships and cultivate business growth.
Along the way, you will have the opportunity to expand your breadth and depth of knowledge in data discovery and analysis. You will help shape product roadmap based on the needs and requirements of the customers you work with.
Looker is a unified platform that powers data experiences and delivers actionable business insights to employees at the point of decision. Looker integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web-scale.

Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Develop customized presentations, demonstrations and prototypes of the software to articulate use cases and value to the customer.
‚Ä¢ Participate in selling the value of Looker‚Äôs products using multiple channels, including phone, presentation, and live online and in-person product demonstrations.

‚Ä¢ Manage customer trials, ensuring that they are engaging with the product, the trial and the resulting solution.

‚Ä¢ Articulate and educate on technical and architectural concepts to a variety of audiences, including developers, architects, and IT professionals.

‚Ä¢ Respond to functional and technical elements of Request for Proposals (RFP) as necessary, leverage and build upon existing knowledge base.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

json.description:
Minimum qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
‚Ä¢ 4 years of experience in data analytics, Trust and Safety, policy, cyber-security, or related fields.
‚Ä¢ Experience in performing on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis, including weekend coverage.
‚Ä¢ Experience in analyzing data sets using up-to-date tools (e.g., SQL, Business Intelligence/dashboards).
‚Ä¢ Experience conducting risk-based analysis and recommending actions or solutions.
‚Ä¢ Experience in content policy, anti-abuse or customer support operations, and with Google products, infrastructure, and types of online abuse.

Preferred qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Experience with Machine Learning and Large Language Model (LLMs).
‚Ä¢ Experience in SQL, building dashboards, data collection/transformation, visualization/dashboards, or in a scripting/programming language (e.g., Python).
‚Ä¢ Experience in developing detailed operational processes from scratch.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work through ambiguity and grow in a rapidly changing environment, remaining calm under pressure.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work successfully in cross-functional teams, including with c-level stakeholders and executives.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal) and the ability to influence cross-functionally at various levels.

About the job

Trust and Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what‚Äôs right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.
In this role, you will be responsible for protecting Google and its users by fighting abuse and badness on a wide range of Search and AI features. You will ensure trust and reputation not only for Search, but also for Google as a broader brand and company. You will be a leader who possesses the ability to work globally and cross-functionally with multiple internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influencing and communication. You will have to apply investigative thinking to understand problems touching hundreds of millions of Google‚Äôs users and support decisions with data. You will have excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in an ever-changing environment. You will find work to be fun and testing, offering you a huge and meaningful impact.
At Google we work hard to earn our users‚Äô trust every day. Trust and Safety is Google‚Äôs team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google‚Äôs products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Manage policy escalations processes across Search and Generative AI and make consistent policy decisions and implement timely fixes, often under pressure.
‚Ä¢ Analyze data on past escalations to drive process, product, and policy improvements.
‚Ä¢ Build cross-functional partnerships with product, policy, and engineering teams.
‚Ä¢ Develop strategy and goals to ensure user trust and safety across products.
‚Ä¢ Leverage Large Language Model (LLM) and Machine Learning (ML) technologies to build scalable solutions for solving abuse problems. Work with sensitive content or situations and be exposed to graphic, controversial, or upsetting topics or content.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

Job Description

Senior Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) Consultant

Job Description

As a Senior Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) Consultant, you will be responsible for leading and managing the implementation of Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) solutions.

Your expertise in Oracle FDI architecture, data modelling, and analytics will be essential in providing strategic insights, designing scalable solutions, and driving data-driven decision-making for our clients.

This role requires a deep understanding of Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI), including its integration with Oracle Cloud ERP, HCM, and SCM.

You will work closely with business stakeholders, analysts, developers, and project managers to ensure the successful execution of end-to-end data intelligence and analytics solutions.

Your role will also include training super users, knowledge transfer, and providing technical leadership on best practices for data extraction, transformation, and reporting.

Roles and Responsibilities

You will:

Lead the implementation, configuration, and customisation of Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) to align with business needs.
Work closely with clients to understand business objectives, data sources, and reporting requirements, ensuring optimal analytics solutions.
Design and develop FDI-driven reports, dashboards, and predictive analytics to enhance decision-making capabilities.
Provide technical expertise on Oracle FDI architecture, including semantic models, data pipelines, and performance optimisation.
Oversee data integration and transformation processes, ensuring seamless ETL from Oracle Cloud ERP, HCM, SCM, and third-party applications.
Collaborate with business users to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop self-service analytics using FDI tools.
Optimise data warehouse performance, ensuring efficient query execution and real-time data accessibility.
Conduct performance tuning, troubleshooting, and continuous improvements to enhance FDI reporting efficiency.
Stay updated on Oracle FDI product enhancements, industry trends, and best practices, incorporating them into ongoing projects.
Develop training materials and knowledge transfer sessions for clients and internal teams to promote FDI adoption.
Facilitate unit testing, UAT execution, and validation with business users, ensuring accuracy and compliance in reporting.
Lead data governance initiatives, ensuring data accuracy, security, and compliance with relevant regulations.

Qualifications

You will have:

Hands-on experience with Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) with a strong focus on data modelling and analytics.
Extensive knowledge of Oracle Analytics offerings, including Fusion Data Intelligence, OAC, OBIEE, Machine Learning, and ADW.
Strong expertise in data warehousing concepts, including ETL, data pipelines, and semantic modelling within Oracle FDI.
Proven ability to build advanced analytics, KPIs, and data visualisations within FDI to drive business insights.
Experience in Oracle Cloud ERP, HCM, or SCM data structures, with the ability to integrate multiple Oracle Cloud modules.
Hands-on experience with PL/SQL, data transformations, and BI Publisher, as well as Oracle‚Äôs built-in analytics tools.
Strong understanding of business intelligence principles, including trend analysis, forecasting, and predictive analytics.
Ability to independently lead FDI projects, engage with clients, conduct requirement-gathering sessions, and provide data-driven solutions.
Experience in performance tuning and data security policies within Oracle FDI and related cloud applications.
Ability to upskill in digital analytics, machine learning, and emerging Oracle cloud technologies.
Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with experience in training business users and super users.

This role is ideal if you‚Äôre a highly skilled data intelligence professional who is passionate about leveraging Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence to deliver transformational business insights.

You will be at the forefront of next-generation analytics and reporting, helping clients unlock the full potential of their Oracle Cloud applications.

Additional Information

Why Version 1?

Strong Career Progression & mentorship coaching through our Strength in Balance and leadership schemes with a dedicated quarterly Pathways Career Development review

A large training budget for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.

Version 1 Annual Excellence Awards & our ‚ÄòCall-Out‚Äô platform where performance is called out and recognised.

Moments that matter & our enhanced maternity & paternity leave policies for life‚Äôs journey.

Company Description


Version 1’s market leading Enterprise Applications Practice specialises in Finance, Supply Chain, HR, and Payroll Solutions with over 700 Oracle Specialists across the UK, Ireland, US, Australia, India and Slovenia.

We deliver consulting and managed services to transform and optimise ways of working for more than 230 customers through the provision of specialist knowledge right across the Oracle product stack – Oracle Fusion Cloud for ERP, HCM and EPM, eBusiness Suite, JDEdwards, Peoplesoft and Hyperion, not to mention extensive expertise in Analytics, Infrastructure, and Integration.

We have grown both organically and through acquisition, with our most recent acquisition of EPM and Analytics experts Qubix bringing 170 specialists to our team.

Our Oracle Fusion Cloud team has grown significantly over the past 3 years powered by recent business wins including Galliford Try, Bank of England, An Post, Inizio Health, Birmingham City Council, Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea and QBE Insurance.

We have an exciting growth strategy that will see further rapid growth and opportunity to drive value for our customers into 2024 and beyond.

  • UK & Ireland’s premier Oracle, Microsoft & AWS partner
  • Market leader in Oracle ERP and Cloud Applications
  • Consulting, implementation, and support services
  • 3200+ strong, €347m/£302m revenue business
  • ERP Partner of the Year & 10 years as GPTW to work in Ireland & UK

Job Description


Senior Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) Consultant

Job Description

As a Senior Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) Consultant, you will be responsible for leading and managing the implementation of Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) solutions.

Your expertise in Oracle FDI architecture, data modelling, and analytics will be essential in providing strategic insights, designing scalable solutions, and driving data-driven decision-making for our clients.

This role requires a deep understanding of Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI), including its integration with Oracle Cloud ERP, HCM, and SCM.

You will work closely with business stakeholders, analysts, developers, and project managers to ensure the successful execution of end-to-end data intelligence and analytics solutions.

Your role will also include training super users, knowledge transfer, and providing technical leadership on best practices for data extraction, transformation, and reporting.

Roles and Responsibilities

You will:

  • Lead the implementation, configuration, and customisation of Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) to align with business needs.
  • Work closely with clients to understand business objectives, data sources, and reporting requirements, ensuring optimal analytics solutions.
  • Design and develop FDI-driven reports, dashboards, and predictive analytics to enhance decision-making capabilities.
  • Provide technical expertise on Oracle FDI architecture, including semantic models, data pipelines, and performance optimisation.
  • Oversee data integration and transformation processes, ensuring seamless ETL from Oracle Cloud ERP, HCM, SCM, and third-party applications.
  • Collaborate with business users to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop self-service analytics using FDI tools.
  • Optimise data warehouse performance, ensuring efficient query execution and real-time data accessibility.
  • Conduct performance tuning, troubleshooting, and continuous improvements to enhance FDI reporting efficiency.
  • Stay updated on Oracle FDI product enhancements, industry trends, and best practices, incorporating them into ongoing projects.
  • Develop training materials and knowledge transfer sessions for clients and internal teams to promote FDI adoption.
  • Facilitate unit testing, UAT execution, and validation with business users, ensuring accuracy and compliance in reporting.
  • Lead data governance initiatives, ensuring data accuracy, security, and compliance with relevant regulations.

Qualifications


You will have:

  • Hands-on experience with Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI) with a strong focus on data modelling and analytics.
  • Extensive knowledge of Oracle Analytics offerings, including Fusion Data Intelligence, OAC, OBIEE, Machine Learning, and ADW.
  • Strong expertise in data warehousing concepts, including ETL, data pipelines, and semantic modelling within Oracle FDI.
  • Proven ability to build advanced analytics, KPIs, and data visualisations within FDI to drive business insights.
  • Experience in Oracle Cloud ERP, HCM, or SCM data structures, with the ability to integrate multiple Oracle Cloud modules.
  • Hands-on experience with PL/SQL, data transformations, and BI Publisher, as well as Oracle’s built-in analytics tools.
  • Strong understanding of business intelligence principles, including trend analysis, forecasting, and predictive analytics.
  • Ability to independently lead FDI projects, engage with clients, conduct requirement-gathering sessions, and provide data-driven solutions.
  • Experience in performance tuning and data security policies within Oracle FDI and related cloud applications.
  • Ability to upskill in digital analytics, machine learning, and emerging Oracle cloud technologies.
  • Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with experience in training business users and super users.

This role is ideal if you’re a highly skilled data intelligence professional who is passionate about leveraging Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence to deliver transformational business insights.

You will be at the forefront of next-generation analytics and reporting, helping clients unlock the full potential of their Oracle Cloud applications.


Additional Information


Why Version 1?

Strong Career Progression & mentorship coaching through our Strength in Balance and leadership schemes with a dedicated quarterly Pathways Career Development review

A large training budget for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.

Version 1 Annual Excellence Awards & our ‘Call-Out’ platform where performance is called out and recognised.

Moments that matter & our enhanced maternity & paternity leave policies for life’s journey.

Our active ESG & CSR initiative allows you to get involved in local fundraising and development opportunities as part of fostering our diversity, inclusion, and belonging schemes.

  • Certified Great Place to Work for 10 years in a row
  • Flexible mix of Remote/Hybrid working options
  • Pension, Private Healthcare Cover, Life Assurance plus

PLUS, many more exciting benefits… drop us a note to find out more.
